results.title: Preparation for parenthood
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
The changes which take place in the body during puberty are shown followed by a brief resume of development of the embryo, lactation, menstruation and how multiple births may occur.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thora James, Frank Wells and J. Arthur Rank Organisation

results.title: How we begin
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
After discussing external physical differences between the two sexes, the film shows various tuypes of body cells and how cell division takes place in the human embryo after the egg cell has been fertilised.

results.title: Pharmaceuticals
results.creator_credit: Robert Richter, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pesticides and pills for export only”.
The film presents evidence that products banned or restricted in developed countries because of the danger to humans or the environment are exported to the Third World by multinational corporations. This episode investigates the trade in toxic pharmaceuticals.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Pesticides and pills for export only”.
The film presents evidence that products banned or restricted in developed countries because of their danger to humans or the environment are knowingly exported to the Third World by multinational corporations. This episode investigates the trade in pesticides.

results.title: Turnover

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
Deals with the problem of how far should a supervisor delve into the personal life and problems of staff in order to help with personal problems. Cast includes Jack Thompson.

results.title: Stirring the pool
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Peter Weir, Commonwealth Public Service Board and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
A new typist is asked to do a job for the manager instead of the senior typist, who is not present. Afterwards the senior typist voices her resentment, causing the new girl to feel unhappy. Another typist informs the new typist that the attitude of the senior typist is not new and has caused many resignations. What is the answer to internal warfare in the typing pool? Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Peter Weir, Commonwealth Public Service Board and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
